text: Bottle 0.75l at Ratebeer Belgian Summer Gathering 2016 Evergem, Belgium. 03.09.2016. Thanks Klaas for hosting and RB guys for sharing todays beers. 2014 Bottle. Pour it hazy goldenish color with no head. Aroma nice interesting bourbon woody feel. Taste of lemon, pinch of vanilla, just little bit tart, smooth texture, woody feel, perfect balanced, pleasant drinkable, medium to full body, thick feel, lively, long finish. Nice!

Sample of a 0.7 l bottle Appereance: Clear, golden amber with a thin and quickly diminishing, white head. Aroma: Sourish, fruit( lemon, gooseberry) bit of funk and barnyard , traces of oak. Taste: moderately sour, taste follows the aroma, so fruity and light funky, a bit more oak as the arroma. Dry finish. 
 Medium body, slightly above average carbonaton. 
Nice.

3/IX/16 - 75cl bottle @ RBBSG V (Klaas place) - BB: n/a, bottled: 9/II/14 (2016-935) Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, small irregular off-white head, non adhesive, unstable. Aroma: funky, true brett indeed, fruity, slightly smoky/peated touch, lemony. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty sour start, tannins, very acidic, lemon juice, bitter. Aftertaste:s oft fruity notes, tannins, sourish, funky finish. Well done! An authentic lambik beer, at least taste-wise. Not sure about the brewing/fermenting process.
75 cl botte. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is earthy, mild metallic and fruity. Dry, fruity, earthy, wooden. Lingering earthy and wooden finish.

F: not big, white, quick gone.
C: deep gold, hazy.
A: apple, lambic, woody, brett, fruity.
T: brett, woody, sour apples, barnyard, medium body, good carbonation, dry on the palate, very good balanced, 75cl bottle shared at RBBSG V (2016), many thanks.

Contribution. 750 ml. green bottle sampled @ RBBSG V. Bottled 09/02/2014. This one was a lot better than their currant Spontaan Pale & Spontaan Donker, I am inclined to believe that age helped this one. Hazy orange, little brief white head. Nose is dirty barrel, sour old lightly oxidized lambiek, cellar, old lambiek, dirty, smells oddly a bit like an okay qualities 20 year old oxidized geuze, Taste is similar, stale lemon, dirty barn, aspirin, stale almost touch medicinal, old cellar, soap, oxidized lambiek, Oxidized lambiek body. Not the best lambiek ever but a pretty decent one, the current Spontaan editions are another story.
Bottle at RBGBS, thanks for sharing! malty, sour, lots of oak and vanilla. Fair enough,
UPDATED: OCT 8, 2016 At rbbsg16. Thnx for sharing People ! Pours unclear blonde, no real head. Smell is funk, oak, dry. Taste is full, dry, oak, intense funk, rather mild sourness. Not bad at all.

0.75 l bottle from De Bierkoning, bottled in February 2014, shared with Hopfenliebe. Clear, golden amber with a thin, fluffy, quickly diminishing, white head. Sourish-fruity, slightly funky aroma of lemon, gooseberry, some rhubarb, a bit of barnyard and oak. Moderately sour, quite fruity, slightly funky and a little dusty taste of lemon, gooseberry, rhubarb, lots of oak and some barnyard, followed by a medium long, moderately tart, very dry finish. Medium body, spritzy, moderately astringent and quite effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Good one, really well-balanced and easily drinkable.

Bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Burnt orange in the glass with a small off white head round the edge of the glass. Lots of vinegar on the nose. A bit of a sharp taste which lingers a bit too long. Leaves a head at the back of the throat. A touch medicinal - benedictine? Otherwise quite tangy. Definitely interesting.

Bottle brought back from Amsterdam purchased at de Bierkoning and shared with Pix. Pours hazy golden with a thin but lasting off white head. Aroma of apple, vinegar and mild funk. The taste is sour and tart with lots of lemony citrus, light vinegar, funk, hay and bread. Lovely and refreshing. A very good lambic that bears comparisons with some of the Belgians.

Bottle 750ml. @ [ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015 (TEODRBSG15) ] - fonefan & Brugmansia House, Denmark. [ As Eanske Twentsche Lambiek ].Unclear matt medium yellow color with a small, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy barnyard, cheese, acetone notes. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, barnyard, manure, medium dry, fruit - citrus - lemon. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is flat. [20150829]

Bottle at Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015, Ulfborg. Pours hazy golden with a small off white head. Aroma of citrus, cheese, light funk, cobwebs, cellar notes and acetone. Flavour is moderate sour. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.

Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, white wine, grass, lemon, funk. Sour flavour, tart citrus, malts, brett. Nice carbonation, though atypically for an unblended lambic. Finish citrus, white wine, buttermilk. Nice.(from 75cL bottle shared @ THT: Hey Julien is back and Deans floor is moist Tasting)

Bottle at THT. Hazy golden with small white head. Cow dung, lots of wood, grapes, twigs, lots of funk, baby poop, fresh leaves. Medium sour and soft bitterness. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Decent stuff but a bit underwhelming for a geuze.

Bottle at THT. Hazy gold pour with white head. Aroma is really nice, grassy, really nice lemon grass notes, fresh cut grass, light funk. Taste is lightly tart, nice lemony sourness. Palate is light bodied, quite dry with good carbonation. Tasty.

Sample at THT September.
Small white head. Hazy golden pour. A bit watery. Some tartness
Bottle at ulfborg summer gathering 2015. Pours muddy orange with no head. Aroma of tart, lemon, sour, dry, light apples.
Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, 2015. Pours hazy golden with a bubbly head. Wood, funk, serpentine, manuer and a touch of vinegar. Funky and dry with a tart and warming finish. Decent.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, lemon, tart, brett, oak and a little bitter. Flavour is malt, brett, lemon, tart, little sweet, little dry, grapefruit and a little oak.
Bottle. Frothy White mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Moderate sour aroma. Moderate sour flavor. Average sour finish. Creamy palate. Nice.

Sampled @ Danish Summer Gathering 2015

Sehr trübes orangegelbes Bier. Geschmack leicht säuerlich fruchtig, Pfirsisch. Geschmack dezent säuerlich, helles Malz, trocken fruchtig.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sour malt, lactose acid, leather, fruits and has a nice sour finish.

Mild säuerlicher Antrunk und Mittelteil. Etwas, aber nicht sonderlich intensiver werdend, spritzig, rund. Deutliche Holznoten. Mittellanger, vom trockenen Holz dominierter Nachgeschmack. 9/9/10/10//11

At Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015 in Ulfborg. Day 2. 
Hazy golden beer with a small offwhite head. Sourish rubber aroma, grapefruit, earthy, leather, barnyard notes, some rubber. Sour rubber flavor, fruity, grapefruit, yeast notes, leather, barnyard, dandelions, some gooseberries. Quite ok.
Sampled from bottle @ Van Moll Brewpub. Hazy orange color, virtually no head. Smell and taste sourish, very nicely fruity, a hint of wood, slightly barnyard. Love this stuff, very well done!
Goud ondoorzichtig bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt lekker zuur, groene appels. Smaakt ook zo. Vrij zacht.
Bottle shared with Bierkoning: orange beer, sour aroma and taste Thnx for the share Edo, but sours are not my thing...

Bottle, bought @ De Bierkoning and shared @ Van Moll in Eindhoven. Golden color. Cider aroma with lemon and cereals. Cerealas, lemon and red berries in the sour flavor. Long finish with a hint of toffee. Nice!
